AIR PORI FILE.
CITY OF SAN MATEO, CALIFORNIA,
Office of City Clerk
September 8, 1926.
MAYOR JAMES ROLPH, JR., and
BOARD OF SUPERVISORS,
San Francisco, California.
Dear Sirs:
Pursuant to resolution of the City Council of San Mateo,
on the south for the use of San Francisco as a Municipal Aviation
Field.
Our consideration of the matter convinces us that the proposed
site has many
advantages
which makes it far superior to any of the
other proposed sites on the peninsula.
With an area of five hundred acres available, with a length of
over a mile and a half and a breadth of practically a mile, and with
an absolutely level surface, the landing and take-off possibilities
The proposed site is located between the Leslie and Beresford
stations on the main line of the Southern Pacific Railway, with a
train service in excess of fifty trains per day, and on the Main
State Highway leading fron San Francisco to San
Jose
The climatic and air conditions are extraordinarily good and
a portion of the proposed site has been used as an aviation field
Fana make It possible to land
Aviators inform us that absence of fog and
on this site at any and all times,
which would unquestionably offset the time consumed by the addi-
tional distance fron San Francisco.
This field is immediately available and without grading or
other improvement could be used
immediately for aviation purposes.
It is also my understanding that the title to the property is in
such a condition that the site can be immediately secured at a very
ressonable price.
The proposed site is within a very short distance of the City
of San Mateo, which has under contemplation the annexation of the
property immediately adjoining the proposed site, and
so far as the

which makes it far superior to any of the

The proposed site is located between the Leslie and Beresford

on this site at any and all times,
which would unquestionably offset the time consumed by the addi-
tional distance fron San Francisco.
This field is immediately available and without grading or

immediately for aviation purposes.
It is also my understanding that the title to the property is in

The proposed site is within a very short distance of the City

so far as the

Bosrd of Supervisors
September 8, 1926
Page 2.
City of San Mateo can go in extending the customary courtesies between
cities,
it will do so in this instance for San Francisco in the way
of police protection, etc. that may be required.
We urge your serious and immediate consideration of this
proposed
site.
Respectfully yours,
FREDERICK J. SMITH
Mayor of the City of San Mateo.
